intro: Galium watsonii subsp. puberulum, commonly known as the pubescent bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
